channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: HARRIS: Hybrid Ranking and Regression Forests for Algorithm Selection
item.description: It is well known that different algorithms perform differently well on an instance of an algorithmic problem, motivating algorithm selection (AS): Given an instance of an algorithmic problem, which is the most suitable algorithm to solve it?

item.title: Tree Detection and Diameter Estimation Based on Deep Learning
item.description: Tree perception is an essential building block toward autonomous forestry operations.

item.title: Agent-Time Attention for Sparse Rewards Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Sparse and delayed rewards pose a challenge to single agent reinforcement learning.

item.title: LAD-RCNN:A Powerful Tool for Livestock Face Detection and Normalization
item.description: However, there is no study on normalizing of the animal face image with arbitrary directions.

item.title: Max Pooling with Vision Transformers reconciles class and shape in weakly supervised semantic segmentation
item.description: On the other hand, WSSS methods based on Vision Transformers (ViT) have not yet explored valid alternatives to CAM.

item.title: Effective Cross-Task Transfer Learning for Explainable Natural Language Inference with T5
item.description: We compare sequential fine-tuning with a model for multi-task learning in the context where we are interested in boosting performance on two tasks, one of which depends on the other.

item.title: 50 Ways to Bake a Cookie: Mapping the Landscape of Procedural Texts
item.description: The web is full of guidance on a wide variety of tasks, from changing the oil in your car to baking an apple pie.

item.title: PAGE: Prototype-Based Model-Level Explanations for Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Aside from graph neural networks (GNNs) catching significant attention as a powerful framework revolutionizing graph representation learning, there has been an increasing demand for explaining GNN models.

item.title: SoK: Modeling Explainability in Security Monitoring for Trust, Privacy, and Interpretability
item.description: Security operations centers have a number of security monitoring tools that analyze logs and generate threat alerts which security analysts inspect.

item.title: Do Charge Prediction Models Learn Legal Theory?
item.description: The charge prediction task aims to predict the charge for a case given its fact description.

item.title: IITD at the WANLP 2022 Shared Task: Multilingual Multi-Granularity Network for Propaganda Detection
item.description: In addition to finding the techniques, Subtask 2 further asks to identify the textual span for each instance of each technique that is present in the tweet; the task can be modeled as a sequence tagging problem.

item.title: Improving Temporal Generalization of Pre-trained Language Models with Lexical Semantic Change
item.description: Existing methods mainly perform continual training to mitigate such a misalignment.

item.title: Learning to Optimize Permutation Flow Shop Scheduling via Graph-based Imitation Learning
item.description: Compared to the state-of-the-art reinforcement learning method, our model's network parameters are reduced to only 37\% of theirs, and the solution gap of our model towards the expert solutions decreases from 6. 8\% to 1. 3\% on average.

item.title: Emotional Brain State Classification on fMRI Data Using Deep Residual and Convolutional Networks
item.description: We then developed two distinct Convolution-based approaches to decode emotional brain states using only spatial information from single, minimally pre-processed (slice timing and realignment) fMRI volumes.

item.title: GPTQ: Accurate Post-Training Quantization for Generative Pre-trained Transformers
item.description: Generative Pre-trained Transformer (GPT) models set themselves apart through breakthrough performance across complex language modelling tasks, but also by their extremely high computational and storage costs.

item.title: Multimodal Information Bottleneck: Learning Minimal Sufficient Unimodal and Multimodal Representations
item.description: To this end, we introduce the multimodal information bottleneck (MIB), aiming to learn a powerful and sufficient multimodal representation that is free of redundancy and to filter out noisy information in unimodal representations.

item.title: Zero-Shot Text Classification with Self-Training
item.description: Recent advances in large pretrained language models have increased attention to zero-shot text classification.

item.title: Unified Optimal Transport Framework for Universal Domain Adaptation
item.description: Notably, UniOT is the first method with the capability to automatically discover and recognize private categories in the target domain for UniDA.

item.title: Self-Supervised Hierarchical Metrical Structure Modeling
item.description: We propose a novel method to model hierarchical metrical structures for both symbolic music and audio signals in a self-supervised manner with minimal domain knowledge.

item.title: Adaptive Selection of the Optimal Strategy to Improve Precision and Power in Randomized Trials
item.description: Benkeser et al. demonstrate how adjustment for baseline covariates in randomized trials can meaningfully improve precision for a variety of outcome types, including binary, ordinal, and time-to-event.

item.title: Lipschitz regularized gradient flows and latent generative particles
item.description: For empirical measures, the Lipschitz regularization on gradient flows induces a numerically stable transporter/discriminator particle algorithm, where the generative particles are transported along the gradient of the discriminator.

item.title: L-GreCo: An Efficient and General Framework for Layerwise-Adaptive Gradient Compression
item.description: Data-parallel distributed training of deep neural networks (DNN) has gained very widespread adoption, but can still experience communication bottlenecks due to gradient transmission.

item.title: GPS: Genetic Prompt Search for Efficient Few-shot Learning
item.description: Prompt-based techniques have demostrated great potential for improving the few-shot generalization of pretrained language models.

item.title: The Open MatSci ML Toolkit: A Flexible Framework for Machine Learning in Materials Science
item.description: We present the Open MatSci ML Toolkit: a flexible, self-contained, and scalable Python-based framework to apply deep learning models and methods on scientific data with a specific focus on materials science and the OpenCatalyst Dataset.

item.title: Lila: A Unified Benchmark for Mathematical Reasoning
item.description: Mathematical reasoning skills are essential for general-purpose intelligent systems to perform tasks from grocery shopping to climate modeling.

item.title: Reduce Catastrophic Forgetting of Dense Retrieval Training with Teleportation Negatives
item.description: In this paper, we investigate the instability in the standard dense retrieval training, which iterates between model training and hard negative selection using the being-trained model.

item.title: Alleviating the Sample Selection Bias in Few-shot Learning by Removing Projection to the Centroid
item.description: In this paper, we find that this problem usually occurs when the positions of support samples are in the vicinity of task centroid -- the mean of all class centroids in the task.

item.title: Forget Embedding Layers: Representation Learning for Cold-start in Recommender Systems
item.description: In this paper, we present FELRec, a large embedding network that refines the existing representations of users and items in a recursive manner, as new information becomes available.

item.title: Attention Swin U-Net: Cross-Contextual Attention Mechanism for Skin Lesion Segmentation
item.description: We argue that the classical concatenation operation utilized in the skip connection path can be further improved by incorporating an attention mechanism.

item.title: Interpretable Geometric Deep Learning via Learnable Randomness Injection
item.description: LRI-induced models, once being trained, can detect the points in the point cloud data that carry information indicative of the prediction label.

item.title: Parameter-Efficient Tuning Makes a Good Classification Head
item.description: In this paper, we find that parameter-efficient tuning makes a good classification head, with which we can simply replace the randomly initialized heads for a stable performance gain.

item.title: FI-ODE: Certified and Robust Forward Invariance in Neural ODEs
item.description: We study how to certifiably enforce forward invariance properties in neural ODEs.

item.title: Atlas: Automate Online Service Configuration in Network Slicing
item.description: First, we design a learning-based simulator to reduce the sim-to-real discrepancy, which is accomplished by a new parameter searching method based on Bayesian optimization.

item.title: Dataset Distillation via Factorization
item.description: In this paper, we study \xw{dataset distillation (DD)}, from a novel perspective and introduce a \emph{dataset factorization} approach, termed \emph{HaBa}, which is a plug-and-play strategy portable to any existing DD baseline.

item.title: Improving Bilingual Lexicon Induction with Cross-Encoder Reranking
item.description: This crucial step is done via 1) creating a word similarity dataset, comprising positive word pairs (i. e., true translations) and hard negative pairs induced from the original CLWE space, and then 2) fine-tuning an mPLM (e. g., mBERT or XLM-R) in a cross-encoder manner to predict the similarity scores.

item.title: Counterfactual Data Augmentation via Perspective Transition for Open-Domain Dialogues
item.description: The dialogue data admits a wide variety of responses for a given dialogue history, especially responses with different semantics.

item.title: Micro and Macro Level Graph Modeling for Graph Variational Auto-Encoders
item.description: We utilize the micro-macro objective to improve graph generation with a GraphVAE, a well-established model based on graph-level latent variables, that provides fast training and generation time for medium-sized graphs.

item.title: Using Context-to-Vector with Graph Retrofitting to Improve Word Embeddings
item.description: Although contextualized embeddings generated from large-scale pre-trained models perform well in many tasks, traditional static embeddings (e. g., Skip-gram, Word2Vec) still play an important role in low-resource and lightweight settings due to their low computational cost, ease of deployment, and stability.

item.title: FatNet: High Resolution Kernels for Classification Using Fully Convolutional Optical Neural Networks
item.description: This paper describes the transformation of a traditional in-silico classification network into an optical fully convolutional neural network with high-resolution feature maps and kernels.

item.title: Exemplar Guided Deep Neural Network for Spatial Transcriptomics Analysis of Gene Expression Prediction
item.description: This paper proposes an Exemplar Guided Network (EGN) to accurately and efficiently predict gene expression directly from each window of a tissue slide image.

item.title: Mitigating Unfairness via Evolutionary Multi-objective Ensemble Learning
item.description: In the literature of mitigating unfairness in machine learning, many fairness measures are designed to evaluate predictions of learning models and also utilised to guide the training of fair models.

item.title: Unsupervised Learning of Structured Representations via Closed-Loop Transcription
item.description: This paper proposes an unsupervised method for learning a unified representation that serves both discriminative and generative purposes.

item.title: CAD 3D Model classification by Graph Neural Networks: A new approach based on STEP format
item.description: Among the various CAD formats, we consider the widely used STEP extension, which represents a standard for product manufacturing information.

item.title: Learning to Compare Nodes in Branch and Bound with Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Branch-and-bound approaches in integer programming require ordering portions of the space to explore next, a problem known as node comparison.

item.title: QuEst: Graph Transformer for Quantum Circuit Reliability Estimation
item.description: Specifically, the TorchQuantum library also supports using data-driven ML models to solve problems in quantum system research, such as predicting the impact of quantum noise on circuit fidelity and improving the quantum circuit compilation efficiency.

item.title: Time-rEversed diffusioN tEnsor Transformer: A new TENET of Few-Shot Object Detection
item.description: To address these drawbacks, we propose a Time-rEversed diffusioN tEnsor Transformer (TENET), which i) forms high-order tensor representations that capture multi-way feature occurrences that are highly discriminative, and ii) uses a transformer that dynamically extracts correlations between the query image and the entire support set, instead of a single average-pooled support embedding.

item.title: Generate, Discriminate and Contrast: A Semi-Supervised Sentence Representation Learning Framework
item.description: Most sentence embedding techniques heavily rely on expensive human-annotated sentence pairs as the supervised signals.

item.title: ViTASD: Robust Vision Transformer Baselines for Autism Spectrum Disorder Facial Diagnosis
item.description: Research progress in the field of ASD facial analysis in pediatric patients has been hindered due to a lack of well-established baselines.

item.title: Nonlinear Causal Discovery via Kernel Anchor Regression
item.description: Anchor regression has been developed to address this problem for a large class of causal graphical models, though the relationships between the variables are assumed to be linear.

item.title: Model-Free Learning of Optimal Beamformers for Passive IRS-Assisted Sumrate Maximization
item.description: Although Intelligent Reflective Surfaces (IRSs) are a cost-effective technology promising high spectral efficiency in future wireless networks, obtaining optimal IRS beamformers is a challenging problem with several practical limitations.
